intro: Psychotria barbatiloba, commonly known as the hairy psychotria, is a species of flowering plant in the Rubiaceae family. It is native to the tropical regions of Central and South America, particularly found in humid lowland forests. The plant is characterized by its dark green, elliptical leaves with a hairy texture, and it produces small, white flowers clustered in inflorescences. It thrives in shaded environments and is often found in the understory of tropical rainforests. Due to its ornamental value and ecological importance, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens and conservation areas.
